knimeNode.name: BioJava Processor
knimeNode.shortDescription: Analyses the specified data using BioJava (see http://www.biojava.org) and produces the result at output. Depending on the task chosen, other parameters must be chosen to correctly perform the operation: see below for more details.

fullDescription.intro:
This node performs numerous convenient tasks using biojava. It is designed to perform many operations in a single task, which is commonly needed at the ACPFG.
NOTE: The calculations will produce missing values in the results if unknown residues are involved eg. X's in the sequence. Fix your sequences if you dont like this behaviour...
fullDescription.option:
Describes what operation to perform.
Compute hydrophobicity, pI and mass for sequences: performs an average amino acid hydrophobicity calculation, isoelectricpoint and calculates mass in Da (per biojava cookbook). Sequences with unknown residues are skipped
Perform Six-Frame nucleotide translation: adds six columns to the input data, one for each frame translation. Excess nucleotides are trimmed to make the sequence a multiple of 3
Convert DNA to RNA (Universal translation only): conver0ts DNA sequences to RNA using the universal translation table
Convert RNA to Protein Sequence: converts RNA sequences in the specified sequence to Protein sequence
Alternate translation of DNA to Protein (all built-in tables): adds 16 columns to the input data, and converts all DNA sequences to protein using every available translation table
Computing the frequencies of residues at each position in the input sequence(s). This option will add the user-specified number of columns (up to a maximum) with frequencies of each residue letter in each column
Select the (string only) column which contains the sequences to be processed by the specified task
This node does not guess the sequence type, it insists you instruct it via this list. The chosen task will perform automatic conversion as described above.

Only relevant to the position-by-residue task. If you are only interested in the first few residues in each sequence, set this to the required number of starting residues to avoid un-necessary calculation (and improve speed).

ports.inPort: Data to use for the biojava task. Generally, each row is calculated independently although this depends on the task.
ports.outPort: The results of the chosen calculation, which are appended to the input data columns
